docs.lead_paragraph: The appeal to the religious right from Rick Santorum drove the Republican primary contest to new lows.

headline.seo: An End to a Divisive Presidential Campaign
headline.main: An End to a Divisive Campaign
headline.print_headline: An End to a Divisive Campaign

docs.abstract: Editorial welcomes Rick Santorum's exit from the contest for the Republican nomination; asserts that Santorum's appeal to the religious right drove the primary contest to new lows.
docs.snippet: The appeal to the religious right from Rick Santorum drove the Republican primary contest to new lows.

docs.lead_paragraph: House Republicans combined two ill-conceived health care measures into a single bill and passed it.
docs.abstract: Editorial criticizes House Republicans for passing a bill in March that repeals the Independent Payment Advisory Board, a major cost-control measure in the health care reform law, and imposes restrictions on medical malpractice awards; urges the Senate to reject or bury the legislation.
docs.snippet: House Republicans combined two ill-conceived health care measures into a single bill and passed it.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: There are more efficient, simpler ways to collect money, but history suggests we won’t really consider these alternatives.

headline.seo: A Tax Code of Politics, Not Practicality
headline.main: A Tax Code of Politics, Not Reason
headline.print_headline: A Tax Code Of Politics, Not Reason

docs.abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column on the inefficiencies and complexities of the United States tax system; says there are better ways for governments to collect money from its citizens that are superior at raising revenue, but history suggests they are unlikely to be seriously considered in America; blames political compromises for the current system.
docs.snippet: There are more efficient, simpler ways to collect money, but history suggests we won’t really consider these alternatives.

docs.lead_paragraph: An annual conference teaches doctors to wear chefs’ toques.

headline.seo: Doctors Learn to Cook Healthy, ‘Crave-able’ Foods

docs.abstract: Pediatricians, endocrinologists, dietitians and other health practitioners spend three and a half days at a conference in Napa Vally learning how to cook; now in its eighth year, 'Healthy Kitchens/Healthy Lives' is in the vanguard of a major shift in attitude among a young generation of medical professionals who understand the value of good nutrition and healthy eating.
docs.snippet: An annual conference teaches doctors to wear chefs’ toques.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some economists say giving American services companies the same subsidies as manufacturers would raise United States exports and employment.

headline.main: Some Urge U.S. to Focus on Selling Its Skills Overseas

docs.abstract: Some economists say giving American services companies the same subsidies as manufacturers would raise United States exports and employment; they suggest Washington should shift focus away from manufacturers in the drive to double America's exports to take advantage of great untapped potential in growing global economies.
docs.snippet: Some economists say giving American services companies the same subsidies as manufacturers would raise United States exports and employment.

headline.main: Why Do Americans Balk at Euthanasia Laws?

docs.abstract: What would need to change before the U.S. would legalize physician-assisted suicide?
docs.snippet: What would need to change before the U.S. would legalize physician-assisted suicide?

headline.main: Utah Breach Shows Vulnerability of Health Records

docs.abstract: As banks step up their security measures, health providers and retailers have become a more prevalent target for hackers. A breach in Utah is a case in point.
docs.snippet: As banks step up their security measures, health providers and retailers have become a more prevalent target for hackers. A breach in Utah is a case in point.

headline.main: How to Really Simplify the Tax Code

docs.abstract: Trying to eliminate popular tax deductions is not worth the time and is not a substitute for a complete overhaul that would simplify the tax code, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: Trying to eliminate popular tax deductions is not worth the time and is not a substitute for a complete overhaul that would simplify the tax code, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Romney campaign removed ads critical of Rick Santorum after Mr. Santorum’s disabled daughter, Bella, was hospitalized.

headline.main: A Shift in Strategy in Pennsylvania for Romney
headline.print_headline: A Shift in Strategy in Pennsylvania for Romney

docs.abstract: Romney campaign pulls ads critical of Republican presidential rival Rick Santorum in Pennsylvania after Santorum’s three-year-old disabled daughter, Bella, is hospitalized; her medical struggles--and the public outpouring of sympathy for her--have the potential to complicate Romney's efforts to quickly end the Republican nominating fight.
docs.snippet: The Romney campaign removed ads critical of Rick Santorum after Mr. Santorum’s disabled daughter, Bella, was hospitalized.

byline.contributor: Trip Gabriel reported from New York, and Katharine Q. Seelye from Bedford, Pa.
